text: This is wrong. But to be fair, it’s a common misperception. The fifty (50) biggest cities have just 15 per cent of the population, down from 19 per cent in 2000. The five (5) megabigs—New York, L.A., Chicago, Houston, and Philadelphia—have just 6 per cent.
